name: SECTION 16 – MATERIAL, PERSONNEL & THIRD PARTY APPROVAL - PAVEMENT AND SURFACING
16.08.01 - Sealing Chip - Source Property Tests and Sampling

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Sealing Chip shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for Crushing Resistance, Weathering Resistance, Weak Particles Test, Skid Resistance, and PSV
16.08.02 - Sealing Chip - Production Property Test Sampling
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Sealing Chip shall be sampled and tested by an IANZ Accredited laboratory for  Cleanness, Size and Shape, and PSD for G5 / G6
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The binder grade shall be a performance-graded binder complying with the requirements of NZTA M01-A specification.
Standard / Specification - NZTA M10:2020 - 2.3.1, NZTA M01-A, PS - 7.2.8
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - E-2 certification and is up to date

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Chip seal type, chip source, bitumen and/or emulsion grade, % kerosene, AGO and diluents, polymer (if applicable), sand report reports, hot application rate(s) including spray rates
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Applications for approval shall contain the information required by NZTA Q05 clause 4 and the testing information required by Table 5.1
Standard / Specification - table 5.1 of NZTA M1:2022

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - All bitumens used for road pavements construction, supplied or blended by New Zealand-based bitumen blending facilities shall meet all the requirements of Table 6.1 or M01-A specification for the grade supplied.
Standard / Specification - table 6.1 of NZTA M1:2022
Frequency - at least one test per grade supplied following delivery of a shipment into a bulk blending facility.
SECTION 28 – CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITY – PAVEMENT AND SURFACING
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Sealing shall be carried out in accordance with TNZ or NZTA Specifications M/1, M/6, M/13, P/3, and Q/1.
Standard / Specification - M/1, M/6, M/13, P/3, and Q/1.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Before sealing and resealing. A pre-seal walkover with the Engineer to ensure that the surface is swept clean of loose aggregate, dust, dirt and other deleterious matter and the sweepings shall be removed to the satisfaction of the Engineer.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Further to Clause 12 of NZTA B2, the degree of saturation of the basecourse prior to sealing shall be less than 60%.
Frequency - Min 5 Tests per lot  1000m2 max lot size

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - An adhesion agent approved and blended in accordance with the requirements of TNZ M/13 Specification for Adhesion Agents shall be incorporated in the sealing binder.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Engineer will inspect the sealcoat immediately prior to the removal of the temporary speed restriction and after final surplus chip removal is completed.
Frequency - Prior to TM removal and after final sweeping
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - If no traffic on site to bed in Chipseal, 3 days of constant rolling with PTR's and laden HCV's will be applied to bed in the Chipseal.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - If no traffic on site, removal of surplus chip will occur 2-3 days after rolling has been completed. If traffic on site, sweeping and removal of chip will be within 48hrs.
Frequency - 24 hours of completion of any section of seal.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall make no repairs without the prior approval of the Engineer for the methods to be used
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Ensure that weather is suitable prior to spraying & pavement temperature checked.  Pavement surface temperature ≥ 10C.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Paper cover any concrete that could get sprayed by bitumen such as kerbs and barriers
Standard / Specification - NZTA (2005) Chip sealing in New Zealand – 11.2.5.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Set up Spray Plan ensuring joins, overlaps and hand spraying is kept to a minimum; joins are not in wheel paths and overlaps are appropriate for curves, channels, straights
Standard / Specification - NZTA (2005) Chip sealing in New Zealand – Section 11
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Temp. appropriate to base binder and additives +/- 10 degrees. Daily records
Standard / Specification - NZTA (2005) Chip sealing in New Zealand – Section 11

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Confirm spray rate is correct by comparing actual spray rate to that calculated. Note error in measurement increases as area reduces. Within 0.1l/m² from target on spray run.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Monitor chip spread rate and compared to target, record volume of chip used
Standard / Specification - NZTA (2005) Chip sealing in New Zealand – Section 11.3.7
